BR_text.BRsummary: [tune][rllib] Windows: FileExistsError when running rllib tune job
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h3>What is the problem?</denchmark-h>
 
 My script (available below) runs fine on Linux but does not fully run yet on Windows.
 I can't tell exactly what went wrong, but the two major errors I see is:
 TypeError: len() of unsized object
 FileExistsError: [WinError 183] Cannot create a file when that file already exists
 Full error log:
 <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/juliusfrost/acbca090259610a176847e7026dd6d30>https://gist.github.com/juliusfrost/acbca090259610a176847e7026dd6d30</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction</denchmark-h>
 
 Run on Windows OS
 Install pytorch
 Install the latest  and  versions
 Install  if necessary
 Download  from <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/juliusfrost/61b8be67d33b9bc9ab1faf7ada9d2ae3>https://gist.github.com/juliusfrost/61b8be67d33b9bc9ab1faf7ada9d2ae3</denchmark-link>
 
 Run 
 if you don't have a gpu add

comments_2.comment_text: Thanks for the report! I added this to the list.

comments_3.comment_text:
Apparently the  is already resolved in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ray-project/ray/pull/8918>#8918</denchmark-link>
 ; it's just not included in the latest release.
 I've made a PR (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ray-project/ray/pull/9141>#9141</denchmark-link>
 ) to address the other issue.
